evidence_items.text: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle. The airfield boundary fence in the Rwy 07 undershoot had also sustained damage. The barbed wire support arm on one fence pole was missing and the wire had been severed in that location.

Safety reporting With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024. In the MOR, the event type was recorded as ‘ Incident.’ Following a review of the report, ASSI reclassified the event as a Serious Incident and notified the AAIB on 6 January 2025.

Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’ Although they were requested from the commander, further details of the occurrence, which could have provided greater insight into the content and context of their 8 November statement, were not provided to the AAIB.

ICAO Annex (Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation) Attachment C lists typical examples of incidents that are likely to be classified as serious. This list includes: ‘Take-off or landing incidents. Incidents such as under-shooting, overrunning or running off the side of runways.’ The operator did not instigate an internal safety review for this serious incident.
Personnel The commander did not supply the investigation with details of their flight licence, medical status, flying experience or recency.

Meteorology The reports submitted to the AAIB did not contain meteorological information, but the UK Met Office generated a limited aftercast for the time of the serious incident. The report found that: ● The weather conditions on the day were characterised by light east to north easterly winds with scattered cloud.
● The TUPJ TAF included a risk of thunderstorms from 1800 hrs UTC, with an associated forecast reduction in visibility and cloud bases.

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. It then bounced and touched down again close to the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report. The aircraft returned to its home base approximately one hour later.

slot_statements.availability: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew occurred during the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD flight on 10-25 as documented in hist_t2_interim.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: There is no evidence in hist_t2_interim that refutes the communication/coordination breakdown among crew during the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD flight on 10-25.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features observed in the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD incident on 10-25 in hist_t2_interim.

node.statement: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew occurred during the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD flight on 10-25 as documented in hist_t2_interim.

defeaters: Evidence showing explicit communication or coordination breakdown among the crew during the flight
Crew reports or investigation findings documenting communication issues
outcome.reasoning_summary: None of the provided evidence items mention or document any communication or coordination breakdown among the crew during the flight on 10-25. The evidence focuses on the aircraft undershoot, damage to airfield infrastructure, weather conditions, and the crew's lack of awareness of the damage, but does not address crew communication or coordination issues (H1-H8, S1-S3).

slot_statements.availability: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim dataset.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The environmental or marking deficiency remains valid and is not contradicted by any defeaters within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim context.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The identified environmental or marking deficiency aligns with the key features defined for Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim dataset.

defeaters: If evidence showed the light was removed for maintenance unrelated to the incident
If the dataset did not include the inspection findings or was incomplete

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence from H1 and S2 confirms the presence and observability of an environmental/marking deficiency (missing/damaged frangible light) in the dataset scope.
outcome.uncertainty_source: None significant; evidence directly states the deficiency presence and observation

slot_statements.availability: The mechanical/control failure occurred in the Short Bros SD3-60 aircraft with tail number N915GD on 10-25 during the hist_t2_interim phase.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The mechanical/control failure explanation is robust against potential defeaters within the context of the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD 10-25 hist_t2_interim data.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The mechanical/control failure aligns with key features observed in the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD incident on 10-25 within the hist_t2_interim scope.

node.statement: The mechanical/control failure occurred in the Short Bros SD3-60 aircraft with tail number N915GD on 10-25 during the hist_t2_interim phase.

defeaters: Evidence of mechanical or control failure on the specified date and phase for N915GD.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates a mechanical or control failure occurred on 10-25 during the hist_t2_interim phase for aircraft N915GD. The evidence describes an undershoot incident with weather factors and runway damage but no mechanical/control failure.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim dataset.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The procedural deviation in pushback execution withstands potential counterarguments and remains valid within the context of Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with the key features identified for Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim, reflecting relevant operational characteristics.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim dataset.

defeaters: If evidence were found in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim dataset explicitly documenting the procedural deviation in pushback execution.
outcome.reasoning_summary: None of the provided evidence items mention the procedural deviation in pushback execution being documented or available within the specified dataset.

node.statement: The identified environmental or marking deficiency aligns with the key features defined for Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim.

assumptions: The missing frangible light and tyre marks are considered part of the environmental/marking deficiency relevant to the key features for this aircraft and incident.
defeaters: If evidence showed the damage was caused by a ground vehicle or unrelated event
If the frangible light was not part of the key features defined for this aircraft and incident
If the aircraft did not actually undershoot or contact the light

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to  arrest the descent , the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence directly describes an environmental/marking deficiency (missing frangible light at the runway undershoot) that aligns with the key features of the incident involving the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD aircraft undershooting runway 07, as supported by H1, S2, and S1.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No direct specification of the exact key features for Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim is provided, but the described damage and aircraft behavior strongly align.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency remains valid and is not contradicted by any defeaters within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t2_interim context.

assumptions: The missing frangible light constitutes an environmental/marking deficiency as per the claim definition.
defeaters: If evidence showed the light was removed or damaged by other causes unrelated to the aircraft undershoot, or if the deficiency was subsequently corrected before the incident.

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence directly confirms the environmental/marking deficiency (missing frangible light damaged by aircraft undershoot) and no defeaters contradict this within the context (H1, S2, S3).
outcome.uncertainty_source: lack of detailed information on any corrective actions or alternative causes for the light damage.

children_spec.statement: Crew members were physically present and accessible during the operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs and communication device connectivity records to confirm presence and accessibility

children_spec.statement: Communication devices and channels were operational and available for use
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance and functionality reports of communication equipment during the event

children_spec.statement: Crew members were not engaged in other tasks that prevented communication
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze task logs and crew activity reports to determine if any tasks impeded communication availability

node.statement: Communication devices and channels were operational and available for use

defeaters: Evidence showing communication devices were confirmed operational and available
Reports or statements indicating successful communication among crew or with ATC
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided documents indicates that communication devices and channels were operational and available for use during the incident.

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components required for control were physically present and intact
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and physical condition to verify presence and integrity of mechanical control components

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were accessible and not obstructed during operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine operational logs and physical layout to confirm no obstructions or inaccessibility issues

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were functional and capable of performing their intended control tasks
children_spec.test_procedure: Conduct functional tests and review failure reports to assess operational capability of mechanical controls

node.statement: Mechanical control components were functional and capable of performing their intended control tasks

defeaters: Direct evidence of mechanical control component functionality or failure
Maintenance records or system diagnostics indicating mechanical control status
Pilot or crew reports indicating mechanical control issues

quotes.exact_quote: N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to  arrest the descent , the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.

On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence shows the aircraft undershot the runway and damaged a frangible light (S2, H1), and the commander was unaware of striking anything (H4). There is no direct evidence that mechanical control components were functional or failed; the undershoot is attributed to weather and pilot response (S1, H4).

children_spec.statement: Availability of required pushback equipment at the time of operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check maintenance and operational logs for equipment readiness and availability during the pushback event

children_spec.statement: Availability of trained personnel to perform the pushback procedure
children_spec.test_procedure: Review crew rosters and training records to confirm presence and qualification of personnel during the pushback

children_spec.statement: Availability of clear communication channels between ground crew and flight crew during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze communication logs and recordings to verify effective communication during the pushback operation

node.statement: Availability of trained personnel to perform the pushback procedure

defeaters: Evidence showing presence or absence of trained personnel for pushback procedure in the dataset.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided dataset addresses the availability of trained personnel to perform the pushback procedure.

node.statement: Crew members were not engaged in other tasks that prevented communication

defeaters: Direct evidence showing crew were engaged in other tasks preventing communication
Statements or reports indicating crew distraction or multitasking during the event

quotes.exact_quote: Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence indicates the crew was unaware of striking obstacles and did not report the incident, suggesting they were not distracted by other tasks preventing communication (H3, H4, S3). However, no direct evidence confirms their engagement status, so the claim is unlikely but not fully disproven.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No direct evidence about crew task engagement or communication availability; only indirect inference from lack of reporting and awareness

node.statement: Availability of required pushback equipment at the time of operation

defeaters: Evidence showing presence or absence of pushback equipment at the time of operation
Documentation or reports specifically about pushback equipment availability
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided documents addresses the availability of required pushback equipment at the time of operation.

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental markings were present and visible at the time of the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Review photographic or video evidence and witness statements to confirm the presence and visibility of environmental markings at the incident location and time

children_spec.statement: Environmental markings were maintained and not obscured or damaged
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and conduct physical inspection reports to verify the condition and upkeep of environmental markings prior to the incident

children_spec.statement: Environmental markings were appropriately located to provide necessary guidance or warnings
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare the placement of markings against regulatory standards and guidelines to determine if they were correctly positioned for effective use

node.statement: Relevant environmental markings were present and visible at the time of the incident

defeaters: If evidence showed all relevant environmental markings were intact and visible at the time of the incident, or if the missing light was unrelated to the incident timing.

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1 and S2 directly indicate that a frangible runway light was missing/damaged due to the aircraft undershooting the runway, implying relevant environmental markings were not fully present and visible at the time of the incident.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit statement confirming the visibility and presence of all relevant environmental markings at the exact time of the incident; only post-incident inspection results are available.
